description.narrative: The project aims at developing the run-of-river Gbedin Falls Hydro Power Plant with a total capacity of 9.34 MW. The power plant will be located in the Mani River in the Nimba County and connect to the existing 7.8 km /33 kV cross-border transmission line between Liberia and Côte d’Ivoire. The project is expected to become a source of reliable, sustainable and affordable power in the region, allow grid expansion to isolated localities and remote areas, and encourage the connection of a larger amount of households, businesses and industries to the national grid.

activity-date.narrative: Planned start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA
